alert.note: Alert for Malheur County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 13 at 3:33PM PDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Owyhee and southeastern Malheur Counties through 515 PM MDT/415 PM PDT/... At 432 PM MDT/332 PM PDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over 45 Hill, or 39 miles east of McDermitt, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... 45 Hill and 45 Ranch Launch Site around 440 PM MDT. Star Valley Ranch around 450 PM MDT. Coyote Hole around 500 PM MDT. Bull Camp Butte and Homer Wells Reservoir around 510 PM MDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
